page.title: 05Inns - Past and Present.
page.content: Bruton was a town well supplied with inns and the main reason for this would have been the many travellers coming through the town, needing places to stay, change horses or have a meal. Currently the town boasts four pubs - {The Castle}and {The Sun} in the High Street, and {The Royal {Oak}and {The Blue Bell}in Coombe Street. However, there were many other pubs, and these included the George, the Unicorn (on the site of the National Westminster Bank), the Old Bull in Patwell Street (closed in 1960), the Swan, the King's Arms, the Crooked Fish, and the Maypole Inn at the bottom of Coombe Street. The largest pub was probably the White Hart, built in 1588. It was burnt in 1731 and on reopening was named The Blue Ball; in 1984, the name was changed to {The Blue Bell.
